content: <collection xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/MARC21/slim">    <dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:invenio="http://invenio-software.org/elements/1.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd"><dc:identifier>doi:10.1039/C3TA10632B</dc:identifier><dc:creator>Peng Gao</dc:creator><dc:creator>Yong Joo Kim</dc:creator><dc:creator>Jun-Ho Yum</dc:creator><dc:creator>Thomas W. Holcombe</dc:creator><dc:creator> Mohammad K. Nazeeruddin</dc:creator><dc:creator>Michael Graetzel</dc:creator><dc:title>Facile synthesis of a bulky BPTPA donor group suitable for cobalt electrolyte based dye sensitized solar cells</dc:title><dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject><dc:description><p>An efficient synthesis of&nbsp;<em>N</em>-(2&prime;,4&prime;-bis(hexyloxy)-[1,1&prime;-biphenyl]-4-yl)-<em>N</em>-(4-bromophenyl)-2&prime;,4&prime;-bis(hexyloxy)-[1,1&prime;-biphenyl]-4-amine&nbsp;(BPTPA donor,&nbsp;<strong>5</strong>) was developed based on a new 4-step synthetic route. The BPTPA donor is used to quickly access two new sensitizers:&nbsp;<strong>NT35</strong>&nbsp;and<strong>G220</strong>, which both exhibit greater IPCE response with cobalt-based redox shuttles, compared to the classical iodide/triiodide electrolyte. A reference sensitizer,&nbsp;<strong>G221</strong>, comprising only a TPA unit as the donor and&nbsp;cyanoacrylic acid&nbsp;as the acceptor/anchor unit, was also realized for comparative purposes. The devices consisting of the sensitizers bearing the BPTPA donor and cobalt-based redox shuttles showed the highest&nbsp;<em>J</em><sub>sc</sub>,&nbsp;<em>V</em><sub>oc</sub>&nbsp;and&nbsp;IPCE spectra&nbsp;response compared to&nbsp;<strong>G221</strong>. The BPTPA donor is shown to efficiently suppress the electron recombination between the TiO<sub>2</sub>&nbsp;surface and the redox shuttle yielding high&nbsp;<em>V</em><sub>oc</sub>&nbsp;values. Among these sensitizers,&nbsp;<strong>G220</strong>showed the best photovoltaic performance having a short-circuit photocurrent density (<em>J</em><sub>sc</sub>) of 14.8 mA cm<sup>&minus;2</sup>, an open-circuit photovoltage (<em>V</em><sub>oc</sub>) of 0.87 V, and a fill factor (FF) of 0.71, corresponding to an overall conversion efficiency of 9.06% under standard global AM 1.5 solar light conditions. These results demonstrate that organic sensitizers based on this bulky BPTPA donor are promising candidates for cobalt-based DSSCs.</p></dc:description><dc:publisher/><dc:date>2013-03-07</dc:date><dc:source>http://zenodo.org/record/12472</dc:source><dc:doi>10.1039/C3TA10632B</dc:doi><dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/12472</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>oai:zenodo.org:12472</dc:identifier></dc:dc>   </collection>
